page.title: 11Spilsil Court,Staplehurst.
page.content: Spilsil Court has passed through many vicissitudes since its name first appears in 1307 when a family of that name lived there during Edward II's reign. The fourteenth century house would have been fortified and surrounded by a moat.This is easy to visualize when looking at the three ponds that remain today although the actual house of that date must have been incorporated into the later Elizabethan structure. During the Regency and Victorian period Spilsil temporarily ceased to be the manor house and became more and more derelict as a farm. The gardens of Spilsil have today many features which were commonplace in the days of Elizabeth I including a fine herb garden.
